channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Right thing to give jab to children in Wales, Plaid says
item.description: A decision from the chief medical officer on jabs for 12 to 15-year-olds is expected within days.

item.title: GDPR: Welsh government breached data laws 300 times since 2019
item.description: Cases include "unauthorised disclosure" of personal sensitive data including criminal allegations.

item.title: Photographer tracks down Conwy castle proposal couple
item.description: The romantic photo of a man proposing on bended knee has been shared thousands of times online.

item.title: Gareth Bale: I never planned to retire, says Wales and Real Madrid star
item.description: Gareth Bale says he "never planned" to retire as he aims to put doubts about his future to one side and lead Wales to a first World Cup since 1958.

item.title: Green Man: 70 Covid cases linked to Brecon Beacons festival
item.description: The cases are "not necessarily attributable" to transmission at the festival, Public Health Wales says.

item.title: Man arrested after woman found unconscious in Tonyrefail
item.description: The 33-year-old woman has been taken to hospital with serious injuries, police say.

item.title: Awel y Môr: Consultation for wind farm off Wales' coast launched
item.description: About 100 turbines could be constructed, with the ability to power 900,000 homes.

item.title: Davies and Sugar among four GB Paralympic golds
item.description: British athletes Hannah Cockroft and Aled Sion Davies retain their Paralympic titles, as canoeists Charlotte Henshaw and Laura Sugar also triumph on day 11 in Tokyo.

item.title: Borth Fire: High Street blaze ‘coming to an end’
item.description: Some 45 firefighters were at the scene at the height of the blaze.

item.title: Adran Leagues: A new era begins for Welsh women's football
item.description: A new era in Welsh women's domestic football begins this weekend as the Adran Leagues kick off.

item.title: M4 reopens after road closed near Cardiff due to crash
item.description: The eastbound carriageway near Cardiff has reopened after a crash left it shut.

item.title: Flu jab delay: Doctors call for MPs to take action
item.description: Flu jabs in England and Wales are delayed due to an HGV driver shortage, a supplier says.

item.title: Borth fire: Flames and black smoke billow from blaze
item.description: The fire broke out in a three-storey property with 30 firefighters trying to stop it spreading.

item.title: Covid, Brexit and driver shortage blamed for bin collection delays
item.description: Some residents are complaining that rubbish has been left on their streets for weeks.

item.title: Tokyo Olympians welcomed home to Ystrad Mynach and Blackwood
item.description: Boxing gold medallist Lauren Price said it was "amazing" to give back to their home towns.

item.title: Covid: Diary records how pandemic changed care home life
item.description: A former journalist writes a diary of his experiences during lockdown, including being in hospital.

item.title: Caerphilly fire: Firefighters tackle blaze at recycling plant
item.description: The fire service said the blaze involved 200 tonnes of metal and was "well developed".

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 15-year-old Cardiff sprinter with big dreams
item.description: Sprinter Tomi Roberts-Jones has cerebral palsy and, aged 15, has already represented Wales.

item.title: Laura Sugar: Tokyo Paralympics Para-canoe champion hopes gold can inspire others
item.description: Tokyo Paralympics champion Laura Sugar hopes her Para-canoe gold medal inspires other people with her disability to take up sport.

item.title: Gareth Bale says banning teams may be 'best thing to do' about racism from fans
item.description: Wales captain Gareth Bale says banning teams if their supporters continue to racially abuse players may be the "best thing to do".

item.title: Newport County 2-2 Leyton Orient: Telford strike denies O's
item.description: Substitute Dom Telford denies Leyton Orient the win in Newport's first home league match of the season.

item.title: Southend United 2-2 Wrexham: Parkinson's unbeaten Reds fight back for point
item.description: Wrexham's unbeaten start to the season continues as they come back from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 at Southend United.

item.title: Welsh Cup: Bala put 17 goals past Brymbo in Welsh Cup
item.description: Bala Town equal the record for the biggest margin of victory in the Welsh Cup tie with a 17-1 win over Brymbo.

item.title: Plaid Cymru: 'Byddai'n synhwyrol brechu plant dros 12'
item.description: Mae'r Cyd-bwyllgor ar Imiwneiddio a Brechu wedi dweud nad oes digon o dystiolaeth i frechu plant iach.

item.title: Medal aur arall i Aled Siôn Davies
item.description: Y Cymro o Ben-y-bont yn ennill ei drydedd fedal aur wrth gystadlu yn y taflu pwysau F63.

item.title: Llywodraeth Cymru wedi torri'r ddeddf diogelu data dros 300 gwaith
item.description: Ymhlith yr achosion mae "datgelu heb awdurdod" ddata sensitif personol gan gynnwys honiadau troseddol.

item.title: Chwarae da ond dim goliau i Gymru yn erbyn Y Ffindir
item.description: Methodd Harry Wilson gic o'r smotyn wrth i Gymru baratoi ar gyfer gemau nesaf ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2022.
